com.apigee.flow.execution
Interface ExecutionContext

public interface ExecutionContext

 Represents context of current execution.
 Provides hook to query the current flow state and to schedule/submit tasks.

Method Summary
 void addFault(Fault fault)
          Adds fault to the current execution.
 Fault getFault()
          Fetchs the first fault in current execution

          Fetches all the faults in current execution

getMarker

Marker getMarker()

isRequestFlow

boolean isRequestFlow()
Checks if the current flow is in request path

Returns:
true if the flow is in request path

isErrorFlow

boolean isErrorFlow()
Checks if the current flow is in error path

Returns:
true, if the flow is in the error path

submitTask

void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task)
Submits a task which is run by messageprocessor's theadpool.

Parameters:
task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread

scheduleTask

void scheduleTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                  long delay,
                  java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit timeUnit)
Schedules a task which is run by messageprocessor's theadpool.

Parameters:
task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread
delay - time to delay the execution
timeUnit - timeunit for delay

submitTask

void submitTask(java.lang.Runnable task,
                Callback callback,
                java.lang.Object handback)
Submits a task with a callback which is run by messageprocessor's theadpool.

Parameters:
task - Runnable that is executed in a different thread
callback - Post the execution of the task, the flow resumes and invokes the callback method on this interface.
handback - Context exchange b/w the task and the callback.

resume

void resume()
Resumes the current execution

resume

void resume(Fault fault)
Adds a fault and resumes the current execution

getFaults

java.util.Collection<Fault> getFaults()
Fetches all the faults in current execution

Returns:
all the exceptions that occurred during the flow since multiple errors are possible during a flow

getFault

Fault getFault()
Fetchs the first fault in current execution

Returns:
the first fault that caused the flow to switch to the error flow

addFault

void addFault(Fault fault)
Adds fault to the current execution.

Parameters:
fault - - fault to be set in current execution
